snippet: The school, in New Britain, directed all students to stay indoors for several hours Monday after a report of a man in fatigues with a gun and a sword.
abstract: Central Connecticut State University officials declare campus emergency after reports that man in ski mask carrying gun and sword was seen walking on grounds; student David Kyem, son of a professor at the university, is charged with breaching the peace and released on bail; Kyem's family says that he had simply returned to school still wearing a costume from a weekend Halloween party at a neighboring college.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS

lead_paragraph: The school, in New Britain, directed all students to stay indoors for several hours Monday after a report of a man in fatigues with a gun and a sword.

headline.main: Central Connecticut State University Ends Lockdown After Suspect’s Arrest
headline.print_headline: Report of Armed Man Causes Campus Stir
